intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: What genre is the film “The Substance”?
questions.explanation: The film, directed by Coralie Fargeat, follows celebrity TV personality Elisabeth Sparkle (Demi Moore). Facing an entertainment industry that is rendering her obsolete because of her age, Moore uses a black market drug called “the Substance” that creates a younger, “more beautiful” version of herself.

questions.question: How many Brown students are studying abroad this semester?
questions.explanation: As Brown students traveled back to College Hill to kick off the spring semester, 255 of their classmates flew to study abroad programs in countries across the globe.

questions.question: By how much will undergraduate tuition and fees increase next school year?
questions.explanation: The Corporation, the University’s highest governing body, approved a 4.85% increase in undergraduate tuition and fees at its February meeting.

questions.question: Who won 3-0 against Dartmouth on Senior Day this week?
questions.explanation: Following senior night, Bruno now ranks eighth in the ECAC standings with two more games left to play in the regular season.

questions.question: How many housing units does Providence’s first temporary pallet shelter, ECHO Village, hold?
questions.explanation: ECHO Village, which consists of 45 single-person units, is the first pallet shelter pilot in the state. The shelters will begin welcoming unhoused people as soon as Feb. 12.

questions.question: What third-party alternative did Andrew Yang ’96 form in 2021?
questions.explanation: Yang spoke at Brown on Feb. 10. He founded the Forward Party — a third-party alternative that aims to put “the power back in the hands of the American voter,” according to its website.

questions.question: Which of the following is one of Brown’s two literary societies?
questions.explanation: The Brown chapter of ADPhi dates back to 1836, making it “the oldest on-campus Greek organization,” The Herald previously reported. Originally an all-male fraternity, the chapter opened membership to women in 1973 — and five women pledged that spring, according to ADPhi’s website.

questions.question: What kind of free community exercise event was held in Providence on Feb. 8?
questions.explanation: “Snowga” is a free yoga event at 195 District Park. The class on Feb. 8 was the second of three sessions, all organized by Jala Studio, that will take place this winter.

questions.question: How many universities, along with Brown, are suing the NIH for federal funding cuts?
questions.explanation: Brown filed a lawsuit Monday against the National Institutes of Health in an attempt to stop a cut to their federal research funding, arguing that it violates federal separation of powers and strips research institutions of congressionally appropriated funding.

questions.question: How much did the National Endowment for the Arts grant art initiatives across Rhode Island?
questions.explanation: Last month, the National Endowment for the Arts announced that it would grant $300,000 to support the work of 12 art initiatives across Rhode Island.
